page.title: 18YOUNG PEOPLE'S LEISURE
page.content: The teens and pre-teens make no bones about putting down{T.V.watching, but even they seem to think that this passive activity is less worthy than playing{sport}:virtually all are active in some branch or another even though this means travelling "abroad". There are local{Guides}and{Brownies} and{Youth Clubs}in both villages. Just as parents underestimate their T.V. leisure so the pre-teens fail to realise how much time they spend just{"playing".} It is hardly surprising, but nonthe- less significant, that many of the young are interested and active in their parents' chosen leisure.So some list walking,gardening,shopping and bird watching.The ones active in music making have musical parents. Few give reading any importance. A sign of the times-computing is listed.
